title: Amarillo, Texas
summary: Amarillo (/ˌæməˈrɪloʊ/[5] AM-ə-RIL-oh; Spanish for "yellow") is a city in the U.S. state of Texas and the seat of Potter County. It is the 14th-most populous city in Texas and the largest city in the Texas Panhandle.[6] A portion of the city extends into Randall County. The estimated population of Amarillo was 199,371 as of 2019.[7] The Amarillo metropolitan area had an estimated population of 269,447 as of 2019,[8] and the Amarillo-Pampa-Borger combined statistical area a population of 308,064.[9]
